plurals.name: isolation_view_accessibility_description
plurals.item: You need to self isolate until %1$s at 23:59. There is %2$s day to go until then.
You need to self isolate until %1$s at 23:59. There are %2$s days to go until then.

resources.string:
The app will send you an alert if you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for the virus.

To enable contact tracing for this app you need to allow ‘Exposure Notifications’.

If you change your mind, you can change your permissions in settings at any time.
Contact tracing helps prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)
Information on the use of tablets
Click here to find out more
If you are outside of England and Wales, you need to follow the guidance for the country you are in.
Enter the first part of your postcode (postcode district)

The postcode district helps with learning about the spread of coronavirus in different areas. This makes sure we can give the best possible public health advice for your area.\n\nDon’t worry. Your postcode district won’t be used to track your location.
Please enter your postcode district code. This is the first part of a postcode. For example: E2, L36, PO30.
For this app to work, you must have Bluetooth on

This app uses Bluetooth to know when it is near another phone with this app installed. If you have Bluetooth turned off, this app will not work.

This app uses ‘Bluetooth Low Energy’ - a battery saving technology.

Please go to settings and turn on Bluetooth.
Please activate Bluetooth in your device settings.
You need to enable location services on your phone

To make Bluetooth work, we need you to turn on location services on your phone.

This app is not using Bluetooth or your location to track you. Your personal identity will remain protected at all times.

If you do not enable location services on your phone this app will not work.

To enable this app to work, please go to settings and enable location services.

You need an English or Welsh postcode district to use this app.\n\nExamples: If your postcode is CE1B 2PQ, please enter ‘CE1B‘. If it is CR0 3RL, please enter ‘CR0’. If it is L4 0RE, please enter ‘L4’.
Why do we need your postcode district?
This app is made for mobile smartphones

Your device seems to be a tablet. This app is only available for smartphones because the app is only effective if you have it on a device that is with you all the time when you go out. Please install the app on your smartphone.

Choosing ‘Book a test for yourself’ will take you to the government’s coronavirus testing website where you will be asked to fill in some personal details (like your address) to get a test. Nothing you enter on the website will be shared.\n\nA digital ‘token‘ will be created to help us get your results back to the app.
Choosing ‘Book a free test nowʼ will redirect you from this app to the governmentʼs coronavirus testing website.
Once there, you will be asked to fill in some personal details (like your address) so you can get a test, but nothing you enter on the app or website will be shared.
The only information shared between app and website is a digital ‘tokenʼ which helps us get your test results back to the app.
Any data used in the testing process is described in the privacy notice:
To find out about how this app uses your data, please visit:
You can only use this app to get a test for yourself. To get a test for someone else, use the Government’s coronavirus testing website:
Book a test for someone else
For this app to work, you must allow ‘Exposure Notifications’

This app uses ‘Exposure Notifications’ to let you know if you have come into contact with other app users who have reported a positive test for Coronavirus.\n\nYour phone might refer to these as ‘Exposure Notifications’ or ‘Exposure Logging’.
Check in to a venue by scanning an official NHS QR code
How to scan an official NHS QR code
Thank you for scanning. You have now checked in!\n\nBy checking in, you will be able to get a notification if people with coronavirus visit this venue at a similar time as you.
It could be that you didn’t scan an official NHS QR code or the code is damaged.
You may be trying to scan an invalid official NHS QR code or maybe this venue isnʼt recognised.\n\nPlease find another way to check in. Speak to a member of staff for help.
Before trying again, please check that your phone’s mobile data settings are on, check your Wi-Fi connection (if you’re using one) and make sure that Airplane Mode is off.
There has been a change in your area
You recently visited a venue on the same day as others who have tested positive for coronavirus (COVID-19).
These notifications help to keeping track of the risk of infection in your area.
These notifications inform about your isolation status
These notifications inform about your test results
These notifications inform about your app availability
These notifications tell you about recommended app updates
These notifications inform about your app configuration
These notifications inform about your app’s background activities
Our guidance to you has changed
You need to self-isolate immediately. You have been in close contact with someone who has coronavirus (COVID-19).
The app is not currently available
Please update your NHS COVID-19 app to the latest version
Time to turn contact tracing back on
Check in to a venue by scanning an official NHS QR code
This app uses your camera to check in to venues like bars and restaurants.\n\nPlease allow camera permissions to scan the official NHS QR code.
Enter the code you received from the testing service by email or SMS with your test result
You do not need to do this if you booked the test from the app.
No internet. Please connect to your network or WiFi and try again.
Something went wrong. Please try again.
Select as many of the symptoms as apply to you
If you don’t have any of these symptoms, there’s no need for you to do anything right now. If you develop any of these symptoms, check them on this app and book a free test immediately.
Before trying again, please check that your phone’s mobile data settings are on, check your Wi-Fi connection (if you’re using one) and make sure that Airplane Mode is off.
I don’t have any of these symptoms
Confirm you do not have any of these symptoms
Any selected symptoms will be unselected.
You recently visited a venue on the same day as others who have tested positive for coronavirus (COVID-19).

There is only a small risk that you have been infected with coronavirus during your visit. You should continue to follow the latest advice on social distancing.

If you have symptoms of coronavirus you must self-isolate immediately. This means you should stay at home with no visitors. Use the symptom checker on the app and book a free test if advised to do so. Call 119 if you have questions.

Only get a test if you have coronavirus symptoms.
You need to either choose your symptoms or select “I donʼt have any of these symptoms”
You are unlikely to have coronavirus
If you develop any of these symptoms, report them on this app and book a free test. Only get a test if you have coronavirus symptoms.\n\nFor further advice, please contact:
You need to either enter a date or select “I donʼt remember the date”
Do you remember the first time you started feeling any of these symptoms?
You do not appear to have coronavirus symptoms
Your coronavirus test result is positive
Your coronavirus test result is negative but you may still develop symptoms, so you should stay in isolation
We could not tell if you had coronavirus
Your coronavirus test result is positive.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.\n\nYour test result shows that you did not have the virus when the test was done. You have been sent more information by email, text or phone. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
You have been released from isolation since the %s at 23:59
However, if you have a high temperature, continue to self-isolate until it returns to normal
Visit our common questions page to learn more about the NHS COVID-19 app and the wider programme.
Our policies tells you important information about using the app, how we use your data, and how the app is designed to be usable by everyone.

NHS Test & Trace
Department of Health and Social Care
39 Victoria Street
Westminster
London
SW1H 0EU
UK
Although you tested positive, your period for self-isolation is over
However, if you have a high temperature, continue to self-isolate until it returns to normal

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent an email or text with more information.
Don’t worry - for most people symptoms are quite mild. However, if your symptoms do worsen then you should call 111 or visit nhs.uk for more advice.
To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.

Because you took a rapid swab test, you now need to get another type of test that is sent to a lab to verify the result.

In the meantime, you and anyone you live with must self-isolate immediately.
Don’t worry - for most people symptoms are quite mild. However, if your symptoms do worsen then you should call 111 or visit nhs.uk for more advice.
Your coronavirus test result is negative

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.\n\nWe could not tell if you had coronavirus when the test was done and you should take the test again. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
Your coronavirus test result is negative

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.\n\nWe could not tell if you had coronavirus when the test was done and you should take the test again. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
We will let other app users know they have been near to someone who has tested positive for coronavirus

The app creates IDs (a random series of numbers, letters and symbols) which your device shares regularly in order to keep your Exposure Notifications up to date. Exposure Notifications help the app work out who over the last 14 days should be notified that they may have been exposed to coronavirus. 

By selecting continue we will be able to send notifications to other app users who need to be alerted across England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland, Jersey and Gibraltar. 

Your personal details or identity will not be shared.

This app uses contact tracing technology to help protect yourself and others so we can all get back to the things we love.

The app notices and logs other nearby app users. If any of those users later test positive for coronavirus, you’ll receive an alert with advice.

The app also lets you report your symptoms and find out if you need a test.

You can also use it to scan official NHS QR codes to quickly and easily check in to places you visit.

The app has access to the postcode district you added in the registration, a history of the places you’ve checked into in the last 14 days, your last test result and the start date of your symptoms. When you use QR codes to check into venues, venue data is stored for 21 days. You can delete the stored data whenever you want.
Deleting your data will reset the app
Hold your phone so that the official NHS QR code appears in the box above. When your phone recognises the QR code, it will show that you have successfully checked in.
If you are not able to scan a QR code and need to check in another way, please speak to a member of staff.
How do I recognise an official NHS QR code?
This is what the official English/Welsh NHS QR code poster looks like. Use your phone camera to scan the QR code which is the square in the middle.
This is an example of an official English QR poster
This is an example of an official Welsh QR poster

This app uses official NHS QR codes to help you quickly and easily check into places you visit - like restaurants or bars. If you use the app, we can let you know if you may have been exposed to the virus somewhere you’ve visited.
This app feature makes it easy for businesses to support contact tracing. It helps all of us stay safe, while keeping your privacy protected.
This app helps us keep each other safe
You will be helping us beat COVID-19 by sharing anonymous information about the virus in your region and public health when you use the app.
Find out when you’ve been near other app users who have tested positive for coronavirus.
Use the app’s QR code scanner to check into places like bars and restaurants without having to fill out any forms.
Feeling unwell? Find out whether you could have coronavirus and order a free test if you need one.
If you are isolating, the app will count down the days and give you the right information.
You must confirm that you are 16 years or over to be able to use this app.
Unfortunately, this app is only for people aged 16 years or over
Thank you for your interest. This app is only for people aged 16 years or over.

The NHS values your privacy, meaning the app cannot tell who you are, where you are or who is with you.

If you test positive for coronavirus, you can choose to share your data with the NHS so we can alert other app users in England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland, Jersey and Gibraltar. By selecting continue we will be able to send notifications to other app users who need to be alerted across these locations.

We use automated decision making to help determine which other users need to be anonymously alerted.

The app securely and anonymously stores data for 14 days after it has been recorded. When you use QR codes to check into venues, venue data is stored for 21 days. You can delete the data from the app at anytime in your app settings, or by uninstalling the app. Your phone may keep some basic data – this is controlled by your phone’s operating system.
When you use the app you will be helping your community stay healthy and save lives. Anonymous information from the app helps us know where the virus is and how to control it.
Before you activate this app, please read the privacy notice and agree to the terms of use.
Important: Before you activate this app, please read the privacy notice and agree to the terms of use.
No thanks, I do not agree
Your app is active and scanning

Any information you share through this app will only be used for public health purposes. Data held will be removed once you click “Delete data”. This deletion includes any active self-isolation periods and how much time you have remaining. Please note that your phone will retain some information, such as the data your phone collects to log other app users. This data is not controlled by the app but by your phone’s operating system. After deletion if you want to use this app again you will have to set it up again.
Unfortunately, you can’t run this app
Your code wasn’t recognised. Please make sure you are using a valid code.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.

Your symptoms suggest you may have coronavirus. Please isolate yourself and anyone else in your household. That means staying at home with no visitors. You should also book a free test immediately. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Please stay at home to keep yourself and others safe.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.

You don’t appear to have any coronavirus symptoms yet, but remember that it can take up to 14 days for symptoms to develop. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Please stay at home to keep yourself and others safe. Only get a test if you have coronavirus symptoms.
Your self-isolation will finish on %1$s at 23:59
Sorry, your phone doesn’t support venue check-in
Please find another way to check in. Speak to a member of staff for help.
Scanning for an official NHS QR code
A restriction in your settings (for example, if this is a company phone).\n\nAnother app on your phone is using the same technology and stopping this app from working.
The app has detected that you have been in contact with someone who has coronavirus. Please stay at home and self-isolate to keep yourself and others safe.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.

You are at high risk of having and spreading the virus even if you don’t have any symptoms. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Your isolation countdown has started and you should self-isolate for the full period identified. Only get a test if you have coronavirus symptoms.

For further advice, please contact:
Low - your local authority is currently assessed as ‘low risk’, with levels of infection similar to most other parts of the country.
Low - your local authority is currently assessed as ‘low risk’, with levels of infection similar to most other parts of the country.
Medium - your local authority, or a neighbouring local authority, has high or rising levels of infection. Please follow national guidance.
Medium - your local authority, or a neighbouring local authority, has high or rising levels of infection. Please follow national guidance.

High - Your local authority, or a neighbouring local authority, is using additional measures to those in place in the rest of England and Wales (e.g. lockdown) to reduce transmission of infection because of high levels of infection in the local area. A detailed action plan is in place and local resources are being augmented with national support.

High - Your local authority, or a neighbouring local authority, is using additional measures to those in place in the rest of England and Wales (e.g. lockdown) to reduce transmission of infection because of high levels of infection in the local area. A detailed action plan is in place and local resources are being augmented with national support.
Thank you for protecting yourself and others by using the app
Are you sure you want to delete this venue from your history?
Removing a venue will reduce the effectiveness of contact tracing.\n\nOnce deleted, you will no longer receive alerts about this venue.
Setting reminder to turn contact tracing back on in %1$s hours
Turning off contact tracing will impact the effectiveness of the app.
Choose when the app will remind you to turn contact tracing back on
Don’t worry. Your postcode district will not be used to track your location.
Unfortunately this app is not supported in your region. Please download the app for your region or country.
Visit the link to find out more
If you have feedback about the app, a question that’s not answered in our common questions, or you have a technical problem, you can contact us using our online form.
Your coronavirus test result is negative. However, continue to self-isolate as you had a previous positive test result

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.\n\nYour current test result shows that you did not have the virus at the time of testing. If you develop symptoms report them on this app. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent more information by email, text or phone. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
Example QR poster saying Let’s Help Stop the Spread of Coronavirus

Please enter one code above. You will have received this code by letter or by email, and it will look like this:

5apv-enka

Please note, this app is for use by people aged 16 years and over only.

Thank you for helping us improve the NHS COVID-19 app. During this test phase, you will need a unique code to use this app.

We all want to get back to the things we love. And we can all do our bit to help. This app is an important part of the NHS Test and Trace service. The more of us that use it, the more we can improve it.

Until a vaccine or treatment for coronavirus is found, NHS Test and Trace and this app remain a vital way to help stop the spread of coronavirus.
Currently only for NHS Volunteer Responders, Isle of Wight and Newham residents
Where can I find this code?
We could not tell if you had coronavirus
Your coronavirus test result is negative

The test result shows that at the time of testing, you did not have the virus. If you do develop symptoms, report them on this app. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
However, if you have a high temperature, continue to self-isolate until it returns to normal
Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum

Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry’s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.
Any data used in the application process is described in the privacy notice:

The app has detected that you have been in contact with a person who has tested positive for coronavirus. You are advised to self-isolate.

While you’re self-isolating, you may be able to claim financial support depending on your circumstances. Check if you are eligible as soon as possible by using the button below.

This will take you to a website where you may need to enter some personal details. These personal details will not be stored anywhere in this app.
If you live in England and you are having trouble applying, visit:
Help to apply for the Test and Trace Support Payment
If you live in Wales and are having trouble applying, visit:
Help to apply for the Self-Isolation Support Scheme

If you are entering a venue (for example, a bar or a restaurant) that has an official NHS QR code poster, use this app to scan it. The app then registers the time you check in to a venue.\n\nBy using the venue check-in, you will be able to get a notification if people with coronavirus visit the same venue at a similar time as you. The notification will include relevant advice, such as to look out for coronavirus symptoms.

We have made some changes to the app to help it work more efficiently when you travel. Several countries are working together so contact tracing continues to work as people cross borders into different countries. 

Official contact tracing apps from England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland, Jersey and Gibraltar will be able to share data whilst preserving user anonymity. 

If you test positive for coronavirus, you can choose to share your data with the NHS so we can send notifications to other app users who need to be alerted in these countries.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent more information by email, text or phone. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Great news! The app is going to be more accurate at giving information and guidance for the level of coronavirus risk in your area.\n\nDon‘t worry, your privacy is still protected. The app will never track your identity or location.

As your postcode district (%s) is in more than one local authority, you need to select the one you are in. This is so the app can give you more accurate information and guidance.\n\nVisit GOV.UK if you do not know your local authority.
You need to choose a local authority to continue
Unfortunately this app is not supported in your region. Please download the app for your region or country.
Please select a local authority. This is so the app can give you more accurate information and guidance.
For this app to work better, please allow it to run in the background

Allowing the app to run in the background means the app can send you up-to-date alerts to have the latest information and guidance.

We do not expect this to cause a significant decrease in your device’s battery life.

You can always change this later by going to Prioritised Background Activity in settings.

If you do not allow, we recommend you to open the app manually at least once every 24 hours.
Don’t worry, we have assessed your risk and there is no need to take action at this time. Please continue to stay alert and follow the latest advice on social distancing.
Find out more about daily contact testing
As an alternative to self-isolation, you may have the opportunity to take part in a daily contact testing programme.

If your daily test was positive and you have received a code by email or SMS with your test result, enter the code in the box above\n\nIf your daily test was negative, you won’t receive a code to enter in the app. You need to tell us you have a negative result and continue.
You must report your result every day, on the daily contact testing website
I have a negative test result from daily contact testing
If you are doing daily contact testing
You entered a test code and indicated to have a negative test result from daily contact testing. Please only provide one of these options.
Please enter a test code or select that you have a negative test result from daily contact testing.
